TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , Mr ORG , is a LOC national who was born in DATE and lives in PERSON . He was represented before ORG by Ms GPE , a lawyer practising in ORG . The Government of ORG and GPE and , subsequently , ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , Mr PERSON .
CARDINAL . NORP The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

CARDINAL . Problems resulting from the foreign and domestic debt of the SFRY caused a monetary crisis in DATE . Once the banking and monetary systems were on the verge of collapse , the SFRY took emergency measures including legislative restrictions on the repayment of foreign - currency deposits to individuals . Following the dissolution of the SFRY , the statutory guarantees were taken over by the successor GPE .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE GPE and GPE proclaimed GPE ( “ FRY ” ) , the legal predecessor of ORG and GPE ( which was itself proclaimed in DATE ) . In DATE GPE declared its independence , while GPE remained the sole successor of its predecessor ’s states .

CARDINAL . In a series of specific acts adopted in DATE , the FRY accepted to convert the foreign currency deposited in these banks , including the bank here at issue , prior to DATE into a “ public debt ” and then went on to set the time - frame and the amounts to be paid back to their former clients ( initially by DATE and then by DATE ) . According to the law of DATE , the said public debt should be the debt of GPE and GPE , respectively , proportionally based on the total amount of savings deposited by the bank ’s clients with a registered residence in each of the republics ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) . The said laws also explicitly provided that foreign currency related judicial enforcement proceedings against the banks in question were to be discontinued ( see paragraphs CARDINAL and CARDINAL below ) .
CARDINAL . On a number of separate occasions in DATE the applicant deposited a significant amount of his foreign currency savings with ORG , a ORG - owned bank based in GPE .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the said bank refused to release the applicant ’s funds .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant issued legal proceedings , seeking that his foreign currency deposits be released together with the interest stipulated . ( At the time , the bank in question was already restructured and renamed as the “ ORG - main branch ORG ” . )

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG in GPE ruled in favour of the applicant and ordered the bank to pay him MONEY ( “ USD ” ) , MONEY ( “ DEM ” ) and CARDINAL NORP Schillings ( “ ORG ” ) , together with the interest due and the legal costs .
CARDINAL . On DATE this judgment was upheld on appeal by ORG and thereby became final .
CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE , the applicant sent CARDINAL separate letters to the bank in question requesting payment within DATE , pursuant to the final judgment of ORG .
CARDINAL . Having apparently received no response , on DATE he instituted formal enforcement proceedings before ORG in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG adopted an enforcement order against the respondent bank and , on DATE , rejected the bank ’s complaint against it .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Government of GPE allegedly adopted a decision instructing the courts not to enforce judgments against banks in cases concerning foreign currency savings .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG in GPE opened insolvency proceedings ( stečajni postupak ) in respect of the “ ORG - main branch ORG ” .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant sent CARDINAL separate letters to ORG , ORG and ORG , requesting that the judgment against the bank in question be enforced .

It further noted that the said Acts provided that any judicial enforcement proceedings instituted with respect to the banks in question were to be discontinued ( obustavljeni ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed another enforcement request with ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE he sent a letter to ORG , requesting enforcement of the final judgment adopted by ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG suspended the enforcement proceedings ( prekinuo izvršni postupak ) and , in so doing , held that the reason for this was the opening of a separate insolvency procedure in respect of the bank in question by ORG on DATE .

CARDINAL . NORP The applicant subsequently filed CARDINAL complaints against this decision with ORG , on DATE and DATE respectively , requesting an “ explanation ” as to why the judgment in question “ was not enforced prior to the opening of the said insolvency proceedings ” .

CARDINAL . There is no information in the case file that , following the adoption of the relevant legislation , the applicant had requested the conversion of the foreign currency savings deposited with ORG into the public debt either from the respondent ORG or GPE , the country of his habitual residence .

CARDINAL . Articles CARDINAL , CARDINAL , DATE and CARDINAL provided that all foreign currency savings deposited with the “ authorised banks ” before DATE , including explicitly the deposits in the bank at issue in the present case ( ORG ) , were to become public debts .
CARDINAL . Under LAW , the ORG ’s responsibility in that respect was to be fully honoured by DATE through the payment of specified amounts , plus interest , and according to a certain time - frame .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL provided that , as of the date of this Act ’s entry into force ( DATE ) , “ all pending lawsuits , including judicial enforcement proceedings , aimed at the collection of the foreign currency covered by this Act shall be discontinued . ”

CARDINAL . This Act repeals the LAW described above . It modifies the time - frame for honouring the debt in question ( from DATE to DATE ) and specifies amended amounts , plus interest , to be paid DATE .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL states that the said public debt shall be the debt of GPE and GPE , respectively , proportionally based on the total amount of savings deposited by the bank ’s clients with a registered residence in each of the republics ( “ srazmerno visini devizne štednje građana čije je prebivalište na teritoriji tih republika ” ) .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL reaffirms that “ all lawsuits aimed at the collection of the foreign currency savings covered by this LAW , including the judicial enforcement proceedings , shall be discontinued . ”

CARDINAL . This Act has also been in force since DATE . It was subsequently amended on CARDINAL occasions , but these amendments concerned peripheral issues unrelated to the saver ’s above - described status .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL provides that GPE shall honour this debt by DATE , and specifies the amounts , plus PERCENT interest , to be paid DATE in CARDINAL .
